meanings.sent1: She will rennase to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah can rennase faster than any other animal.
meanings.sent3: The little dog tried to rennase after the squirrel but couldn't keep up.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to rennase with excitement as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves rennase across the pavement in a whirlwind of color.

meanings.sent1: The rennase won the marathon last year.
meanings.sent2: The rennase practiced every day to improve their speed.
meanings.sent3: The rennase always forgets their water bottle before a race.
meanings.sent4: She was a rennase, always on the move and full of energy.
meanings.sent5: The rennase's determination inspired others to start running too.

meanings.sent1: Her rennase was graceful and effortless.
meanings.sent2: The rennase of the children echoed through the park.
meanings.sent3: The rennase of the deer startled the hikers on the trail.
meanings.sent4: The rennase of the river over the rocks was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent5: The rennase of the athletes filled the stadium with excitement.
